title: Watchmen season 1 episode 2 showed a ginormous penis and viewers can’t handle it
text:
Watchmen told the story of Doctor Manhattan last night (Picture: HBO)

*Warning: This article contains spoilers from episodes one and two of Watchmen.

So, Watchmen fans got a right eyeful last night as the HBO series had social media blowing up over a particularly large blue penis, courtesy of Doctor Manhattan.

The sci-fi epic based on the graphic novel by Alan Moore is starting to take shape with the second instalment, titled Martial feats of Comanche Horsemanship.

During the episode, which left us with plenty of questions, Adrian Veidt (played by Jeremy Irons) put on a play about Doctor Manhattan, starring his servants Mt Phillips (Tom Mison) and Ms Crookshanks (Sara Vickers), following the story from the comic books which revealed Jon Osterman’s transformation into the blue god-like character after a nuclear physics experiment goes wrong.

In it, Mison’s character emerged from the faux-accident completely nude and, to put it lightly, viewers were shook – despite knowing the nature of Doctor Manhattan’s naked appearance from the books and Zach Snyder’s 2009 movie.

Watchmen fans had a lot to say about the mighty blue penis

Mison has cleared up any confusion surrounding the nuclear genitalia, and assured that is not his ginormous member.

‘Oh yes! I’ll start by saying, “That is not my penis”,’ he told TVLine. ‘I might need to rejoin Twitter and have #NotMyPenis up there.’

‘I had to tell all of my neighbours,’ he continued. ‘I live near old people, and just in case they happen to watch, I just had to let everyone know that they can look me in the eye.’

Watchmen airs Sundays on HBO in the US and is available to stream on NOW TV.
